quiz.name: Module 2: Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct
quiz.subtopic: Module 2: Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct

warehouses.name: Warehouse Course: Ethical and Professional Standards 26-LI
warehouses.code: Warehouse Course: Ethical and Professional Standards 26-LI

warehouses.name: Practice Pack Warehouse: Ethical and Professional Standards 26-LI
warehouses.code: Practice Pack Warehouse: Ethical and Professional Standards 26-LI

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020A-Ethics-Pluer-01
entry.itemBody: Oversight of the Professional Conduct Program is the responsibility of the:

answerFeedback.6162bf18-0aa2-49f8-885a-294aab7ae9d4: Incorrect because the CFA Institute Board of Governors maintains oversight and responsibility for the Professional Conduct Program (PCP), which, in conjunction with the Disciplinary Review Committee (DRC), is responsible for enforcement of the Code and Standards. The DRC is a volunteer committee of CFA charterholders who serve on panels to review conduct and partner with Professional Conduct staff to establish and review professional conduct policies.
answerFeedback.809bf820-1787-4bcb-840c-6496072ef0a8: Incorrect because the CFA Institute Board of Governors maintains oversight and responsibility for the Professional Conduct Program (PCP), which, in conjunction with the Disciplinary Review Committee (DRC), is responsible for enforcement of the Code and Standards. The DRC is a volunteer committee of CFA charterholders who serve on panels to review conduct and partner with Professional Conduct staff to establish and review professional conduct policies.
answerFeedback.be6bca45-8f17-49b3-964a-50dce33d65e0: Correct because the CFA Institute Board of Governors maintains oversight and responsibility for the Professional Conduct Program (PCP), which, in conjunction with the Disciplinary Review Committee (DRC), is responsible for enforcement of the Code and Standards.

choices.itemBody: A. Professional Conduct staff.
B. Disciplinary Review Committee.
C. CFA Institute Board of Governors.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020B-Ethics-Pluer-02
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is one of the seven CFA Institute Standards of Professional Conduct?

answerFeedback.87aa0311-aa30-4743-82f3-1e3c9669e960: Incorrect because Standard VI is Conflicts of Interest. It has sub-sections A. Disclosure of Conflicts and B. Priority of Transactions. Disclosure of Transactions is an incorrect combination of the two.
answerFeedback.883ba749-e8a1-4e01-befc-5df010f9a101: Incorrect because Standard II is Integrity of Capital Markets not performance integrity.
answerFeedback.ed9f4e62-e5f2-4a02-b524-e94dbf37438c: Correct because Duties to Employers is Standard IV.

choices.itemBody: A. Duties to Employers
B. Performance Integrity
C. Disclosure of Transactions

entry.title: ITEM_2019BEthics03DPQ20U1
entry.itemBody: The CFA Institute Code of Ethics (the Code) and Standards of Professional Conduct (the Standards) require members to:

answerFeedback.0290108c-2531-4d44-9f46-144ef1199cbb: Incorrect because the Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct states that members of CFA Institute (including CFA charterholders) and candidates for the CFA designation (Members and Candidates) must promote the integrity and viability of the global capital markets for the ultimate benefit of society. Therefore, the Code of Ethics requires members to promote the integrity and viability of the global capital markets for the ultimate benefit of society, not the investment profession.
answerFeedback.badf39c0-aa0a-4708-9c39-d257733cfd27: Incorrect because the reading on the Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct states that members and candidates must only practice and encourage others to practice in a professional and ethical manner, as described in the response rationale for the correct answer.
answerFeedback.cc6ab2da-d0f2-468e-ba5a-60e252c4b7f6: Correct because the Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct states that members of CFA Institute (including CFA charterholders) and candidates for the CFA designation (Members and Candidates) must practice and encourage others to practice in a professional and ethical manner that will reflect credit on themselves and the profession.

choices.itemBody: A. encourage others to practice in a professional and ethical manner only.
B. promote the integrity and viability of the global capital markets for the ultimate benefit of the investment profession only.
C. both encourage others to practice in a professional and ethical manner and promote the integrity and viability of the global capital markets for the ultimate benefit of the investment profession.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q1

feedback.neutral:
C is correct. When an inquiry is initiated, the Professional Conduct staff conducts an investigation that may include requesting a written explanation from the member or candidate.

A is incorrect because Professional Conduct inquiries can be initiated in response to information provided by the media. CFA Institute staff may become aware of questionable conduct by a member or candidate through the media, regulatory notices, or other public sources.

B is incorrect because although the Disciplinary Review Committee (DRC) is responsible for enforcement of the Code and Standards in conjunction with the Professional Conduct Program (PCP), only in the event that a member or candidate does not accept the charges and proposed sanction is the matter referred to a panel composed of DRC members.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements best describes an aspect of the Professional Conduct Program process?

choices.itemBody: A. Inquiries are not initiated in response to information provided by the media.
B. Investigations result in Disciplinary Review Committee panels for each case.
C. Investigations may include requesting a written explanation from the member or candidate.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q2

feedback.neutral:
C is correct. One of the principles in the Code of Ethics reflects the role that the capital markets have in society as a whole.

A is incorrect because it is incomplete, missing the additional language to reflect the role that the capital markets have in society as a whole.

B is incorrect because the principle as written in the Code of Ethics reflects the role of the capital markets in society as a whole.

entry.itemBody: A current Code of Ethics principle reads in full, “Promote the integrity:

choices.itemBody: A. and viability of the global capital markets.”
B. of and uphold the rules governing capital markets.”
C. and viability of the global capital markets for the ultimate benefit of society.”

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q3

feedback.neutral:
C is correct. Given the constant development of new and exotic financial instruments and strategies, the standard regarding communicating with clients includes an implicit requirement to disclose to clients the risks and limitations of recommendations being made to clients.

A is incorrect because the standard for members and candidates with supervision or authority over others within their firms stresses broader compliance expectations beyond the detection and prevention aspects of violations.

B is incorrect because the standards have evolved over time to remain representative of the highest standards of professional conduct and relevant to the changing nature of the investment profession.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following is correct with regard to the Standards of Professional Conduct?

choices.itemBody: A. They require supervisors to focus only on the detection and prevention of violations.
B. They set ethical conduct requirements for members and candidates that have remained unchanged since their creation.
C. They address the risks and limitations of recommendations being made to clients.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q4

feedback.neutral:
B is correct. The Standards of Professional Conduct require members and candidates to promptly disclose any changes that might materially affect investment processes.

A is incorrect because under Standard III(C) Suitability, when members and candidates are responsible for managing a portfolio according to a specific mandate, they must take only investment actions that are consistent with the stated objectives of the portfolio and not be concerned with whether the mandate is suitable for all investors.

C is incorrect because under Standard III(E) Preservation of Confidentiality, members and candidates must keep information about current clients confidential unless the information concerns illegal activities on the part of the client, disclosure is required by law, or the client permits disclosure. No decisions on confidentiality are required, with the “reasonable and adequate basis” criterion related to Standard V(A) Diligence and Reasonable Basis.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements best describes an aspect of the Standards of Professional Conduct? Members and candidates are required to:

choices.itemBody: A. ensure a portfolio mandate is suitable for all investors.
B. promptly disclose changes that might materially affect investment processes.
C. have a reasonable and adequate basis for decisions about client confidentiality.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q5

feedback.neutral:
B is correct. Under Standard II(A) Material Nonpublic Information, members who possess material nonpublic information that could affect the value of an investment must not cause others to act on the information.

A is incorrect because price distortion is mentioned in Standard II(B) Market Manipulation, not Standard II(A) Material Nonpublic Information.

C is incorrect because the maintenance of appropriate records to support investment analyses is noted in Standard V(C) Record Retention, not Standard II(A) Material Nonpublic Information.

entry.itemBody: A CFA Institute member or candidate violates Standard II(A) Material Nonpublic Information by:

choices.itemBody: A. conducting price distortion practices.
B. inappropriately causing others to act.
C. inadequately maintaining investment records.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q6

feedback.neutral:
B is correct. Standard III(C) Suitability states that when members and candidates are in an advisory relationship with a client, they must judge the suitability of investments in the context of the client’s total portfolio.

A is incorrect because this requirement is addressed under Standard III(A) Loyalty, Prudence, and Care, not Standard III(C) Suitability.

C is incorrect because this requirement is addressed under Standard I(C) Misrepresentation, not Standard III(C) Suitability.

entry.itemBody: Standard III(C) Suitability requires members and candidates in an advisory relationship with a client to:

choices.itemBody: A. place their client’s interests before their own interests.
B. consider investments in the context of the client’s total portfolio.
C. not knowingly make misrepresentations relating to recommendations.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q7

feedback.neutral:
C is correct. Under Standard III(B) Fair Dealing, members and candidates must deal fairly and objectively with all clients when providing investment analysis, making investment recommendations, taking investment action, or engaging in other professional activities.

A is incorrect because under Standard III(C) Suitability, members and candidates in an advisory relationship must make a reasonable inquiry into a client’s financial constraints prior to (not after) taking investment action and must reassess and update this regularly.

B is incorrect because under Standard III(A) Loyalty, Prudence, and Care, members and candidates must act for the benefit of their clients and place their clients’ interests before (not maintain an equal balance with) their employer’s or their own interests.

entry.itemBody: Standard III: Duties to Clients states that members and candidates must:

choices.itemBody: A. document client financial constraints after an initial investment action.
B. maintain an equal balance of interests owed to their clients and employers.
C. deal fairly and objectively with all clients when engaging in professional activities.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q8

feedback.neutral:
B is correct. Standard IV(A) Loyalty states that members and candidates cannot deprive their employer of the advantage of their skills and abilities in matters related to their employment.

A is incorrect because accepting gifts that might compromise a member’s or candidate’s independence and objectivity is addressed by Standard I: Professionalism, not Standard IV: Duties to Employers.

C is incorrect because Standard IV(B) Additional Compensation Arrangements permits members and candidates to accept compensation that competes with their employer’s interest if they obtain written consent from all parties involved.

entry.itemBody: Standard IV: Duties to Employers states that members and candidates must not:

choices.itemBody: A. accept any gifts that might compromise their independence and objectivity.
B. deprive their employer of their skills and abilities as related to their employment.
C. accept compensation competing with their employer’s interest without the written consent of their employer only.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q9

feedback.neutral:
C is correct. Standard V(B) Communication with Clients and Prospective Clients states that members and candidates must distinguish between fact and opinion in the presentation of investment analysis and recommendations.

A is incorrect because this standard is discussed in Standard III: Duties to Clients.

B is incorrect because performance presentation is discussed in Standard III: Duties to Clients.

entry.itemBody: Standard V: Investment Analysis, Recommendations, and Actions states that members and candidates must:

choices.itemBody: A. find an investment suitable for their client before making a recommendation.
B. make reasonable efforts to ensure that performance presentation is fair, accurate, and complete.
C. distinguish between fact and opinion in the presentation of investment analysis and recommendations.

entry.title: CFA0006-R-s03-Q10

feedback.neutral:
C is correct. Standard VII(B) Reference to CFA Institute, the CFA Designation, and the CFA Program explicitly states the appropriate manner to make reference to CFA Institute, CFA Institute membership, the CFA designation, or candidacy in the CFA Program.

A is incorrect because Standard VII: Responsibilities as a CFA Institute Member or CFA Candidate does not refer to loyalty. Loyalty is addressed in two other standards, Standard III(A) Loyalty, Prudence, and Care and as part of Standard IV: Duties to Employers.

B is incorrect because Standard VII does not refer to the responsibility of supervisors. The responsibility of supervisors is addressed in Standard IV(C) Responsibility of Supervisors.

entry.itemBody: Standard VII: Responsibilities as a CFA Institute Member or CFA Candidate explicitly states a requirement regarding:

choices.itemBody: A. loyalty.
B. responsibility of supervisors.
C. reference to the CFA Program.

entry.title: ITEM_20170420165
entry.itemBody: Which of the following activities if undertaken by CFA Institute members and/or candidates would most likely violate the Code and Standards?

answerFeedback.0ff589ea-7086-40d0-8655-3b2dc1b6aedb: Incorrect because Standard III(E)–Preservation of Confidentiality is not intended to prevent a member or candidate from cooperating with an investigation with the CFA Institute Professional Conduct Program (PCP). Members and candidates can consider the PCP an extension of themselves when requested to provide information about a client in support of a PCP investigation.
answerFeedback.942331b1-53a2-45be-8b37-04c203555a8e: Correct because Standard IV(C)–Responsibilities of Supervisors states that members and candidates must make reasonable efforts to prevent violation of applicable laws, rules, regulations, and the Code and Standards by anyone subject to their supervision or authority. Interviewing with a competitor during lunch or taking clients out to lunch do not necessarily violate any Standard unless specifically prohibited in company policies.
answerFeedback.c17df368-578f-45a9-ab90-ad89192861af: Incorrect because this action does not create a conflict with their employer. While it may be advisable to get prior approval before this event, this action does not constitute a clear violation of the Code and Standards as long as it does not conflict with any of the company’s policies.

choices.itemBody: A. An analyst discloses confidential, sensitive information about a client account as part of an investigation by the CFA Institute Professional Conduct Program
B. A senior trader does not have safeguards in place to determine whether a junior trader under their supervision is following the firm’s policies regarding best execution

C. An institutional portfolio manager takes a group of clients to an expensive restaurant to discuss portfolio returns over the recently completed quarter without prior written consent from his employer

entry.title: ITEM_20170420024
entry.itemBody: Which of the following least likely reflects the two primary principles of the CFA Institute Rules of Procedure for Proceedings Related to Professional Conduct?

answerFeedback.5ffbbbef-ee5c-4e70-8d72-73c15f82579a: Incorrect because the two principles of the Rules of Procedure for Proceedings Related to Professional Conduct are confidentiality of proceedings and fair process to the member and candidate.
answerFeedback.cc29d617-e3c0-4429-b7a3-6e77dd2c7c93: Incorrect because the two principles of the Rules of Procedure for Proceedings Related to Professional Conduct are confidentiality of proceedings and fair process to the member and candidate.
answerFeedback.ebfe765d-8e12-40d5-875b-16cec81fe514: Correct because the two principles of the Rules of Procedure for Proceedings Related to Professional Conduct are confidentiality of proceedings and fair process to the member and candidate.

choices.itemBody: A. Confidentiality of proceedings
B. Public disclosure of disciplinary sanctions
C. Fair process to the member and candidate

entry.title: ITEM_20170420035
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is not a component of the CFA Institute Code of Ethics?

answerFeedback.911ab464-feb6-472d-a962-931e9ede580d: Correct because punishing abuses in the financial sector is not included in any of the six components of the CFA Code of Ethics.
answerFeedback.95f69673-dc91-4c00-9d71-9a03e20cfeb8: Incorrect because placing the integrity of the investment profession and the interests of clients above their own personal interests is one of the six components of the Code of Ethics.
answerFeedback.f28c81a3-a49e-47ef-9cbb-32b2781fac8d: Incorrect because practicing and encouraging others to practice in a professional and ethical manner that will reflect credit on themselves and the profession is one of the six components of the Code of Ethics.

choices.itemBody: A. Promote financial integrity and seek to prevent and punish abuses in the financial markets
B. Place the integrity of the investment profession and the interests of clients above their own personal interests
C. Practice and encourage others to practice in a professional and ethical manner that will reflect credit on themselves and the profession

entry.title: ITEM_20170420056
entry.itemBody: Which of the following groups is most likely responsible for maintaining oversight and responsibility for the Professional Conduct Program (PCP)?

answerFeedback.71abd020-08f4-4607-b918-16154664d376: Incorrect because the Disciplinary Review Committee (DRC) works in conjunction with the PCP and is responsible for enforcement of the Code and Standards.
answerFeedback.a8de30fd-1cc2-459f-a334-4ada832c420b: Correct because all CFA Institute members and candidates enrolled in the CFA Program are required to comply with the Code and Standards. The CFA Institute Board of Governors maintains oversight and responsibility for the Professional Conduct Program (PCP).
answerFeedback.c727a804-c291-47c5-a4ab-0c72df0cc295: Incorrect because the Professional Conduct Division works with the DRC to establish and review professional conduct policies and is also responsible for enforcing testing policies of other CFA Institute education programs as well as the professional conduct of Certificate in Investment Performance Measurement (CIPM) certificants.

choices.itemBody: A. Professional Conduct Division
B. Disciplinary Review Committee
C. CFA Institute Board of Governors

entry.title: ITEM_20170420058
entry.itemBody: When can a party, nonmember or firm, most likely claim compliance with the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct? Once they have:

answerFeedback.405f01e2-4f4b-4230-a110-03b8db2a0ad0: Incorrect because CFA Institute does not verify claims of compliance with the Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct.
answerFeedback.7bfb718c-4e2e-4353-8c1a-cdc752ba2273: Correct because the Code and Standards apply to individual members of CFA Institute and candidates in the CFA Program. CFA Institute does encourage firms to adopt the Code and Standards, however, as part of their code of ethics. Those who claim compliance should fully understand the requirements of each of the principles of the Code and Standard.
answerFeedback.d0d161a7-8065-463a-aeae-8c1c2f723537: Incorrect because CFA Institute welcomes public acknowledgement when appropriate and encourages firms to notify the Institute of the adoption plans.

choices.itemBody: A. notified the CFA Institute of their claim.
B. verified their claim of compliance with the CFA Institute.
C. ensured that their code and ethics meets the principles of the Code and Standards.

entry.title: ITEM_20170420059
entry.itemBody: Sanctions imposed by CFA Institute for violations of the CFA Institute Code of Ethics or Standards of Professional Conduct least likely include:

answerFeedback.1248ea3b-1195-4250-a8a0-c0af293014d2: Incorrect because sanctions imposed by CFA Institute may have significant consequences; they do include revocation of the CFA charter.
answerFeedback.285ad504-e86c-4cc2-b784-7ab0fbf0d19f: Incorrect because sanctions imposed by CFA Institute may have significant consequences; they do include public censure.
answerFeedback.aea4261c-9d2c-4aef-886e-a4b8dd5ba681: Correct because sanctions available to CFA Institute do not include monetary fines. However, sanctions imposed by CFA Institute may have significant consequences; they include public censure, suspension of membership and use of the CFA designation, and revocation of the CFA charter. Candidates enrolled in the CFA Program who have violated the Code and Standards or testing policies may be suspended or prohibited from further participation in the CFA Program.

choices.itemBody: A. public censure.
B. monetary fines.
C. revocation of a CFA Charter.

entry.title: ITEM_20170420115
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements related to requirements for the CFA Institute Standards of Professional Conduct Standard V(B)–Communication with Clients and Prospective Clients is least likely accurate? The standard requires members and candidates to:

answerFeedback.4721acee-04d7-4ac5-a5ef-3d8288431d9d: Correct because the CFA Institute Standards of Professional Conduct Standard V(B)–Communication with Clients and Prospective Clients does not limit the type or number of staff responsible for external communication.
answerFeedback.ae0c3197-ba58-42a2-aad5-bef3d41802dc: Incorrect because distinguishing between fact and opinion in the presentation of investment analysis and recommendations is a requirement.
answerFeedback.c1ea4306-6b36-4a62-9845-fe1b75b48a15: Incorrect because disclosure of the basic format and general principles of the investment process is a requirement.

choices.itemBody: A. disclose the basic format and general principles of the investment process.
B. divulge the number of investment related personnel responsible for external communication.
C. distinguish between fact and opinion in the presentation of investment analysis and recommendations.

entry.title: ITEM_20170420122
entry.itemBody: Which of the following is most likely found in the CFA Institute Standards of Professional Conduct, Standard I–Professionalism? Members and candidates must:

answerFeedback.4ac90085-cbc5-4d3f-99f5-05222d86b109: Correct because the statement, “Members and Candidates must not engage in any professional conduct involving dishonesty, fraud, or deceit or commit any act that reflects adversely on their professional reputation, integrity, or competence” can be found in the CFA Institute Standards of Professional Conduct, Standard I–Professionalism (D) Misconduct.
answerFeedback.a084dde0-ba3c-4202-96c5-1c1269127a84: Incorrect because the statement, “Members and Candidates must maintain and improve their professional competence and strive to maintain and improve the competence of other investment professionals” can be found in the CFA Institute Code of Ethics. It is not part of the CFA Institute Standards of Professional Conduct, Standard I–Professionalism.
answerFeedback.fad0c805-3f38-4839-a210-45e76b4af540: Incorrect because the statement, “Members and Candidates must place the integrity of the investment profession and the interest of clients above their own interest” can be found in the CFA Institute Code of Ethics. It is not part of the CFA Institute Standards of Professional Conduct, Standard I–Professionalism.

choices.itemBody: A. place the integrity of the investment profession and the interest of clients above their own interest.
B. maintain and improve their professional competence and strive to maintain and improve the competence of other investment professionals.
C. not engage in any professional conduct involving dishonesty, fraud, or deceit or commit any act that reflects adversely on their professional reputation, integrity, or competence.

entry.title: ITEM_20170420051
entry.itemBody: Nicholas Bennett, CFA, is a trader at a stock exchange. Another trader approached Bennett on the floor of the exchange and verbally harassed him about a poorly executed trade. In response, Bennett pushed the trader and knocked him to the ground. After investigating the incident, the exchange cleared Bennett from any wrongdoing. Which of the following best describes Bennett’s conduct in relation to the CFA Institute Code of Ethics or Standards of Professional Conduct? Bennett:

answerFeedback.246ce53b-37c8-4907-816c-b6f1ae0b1f4d: Correct because the CFA Institute Code of Ethics requires members to act with integrity, competence, diligence, respect, and in an ethical and professional manner; the Standards of Professional Conduct relating to Professional Misconduct state members and candidates must not commit any act reflecting adversely on their professional reputation, integrity, or competence. Bennett’s actions violated the Code of Ethics and the Standard relating to Professionalism but not the Standard relating to Integrity of Capital Markets.
answerFeedback.f096dc81-2ace-4381-91f3-8bbd88e1ec1b: Incorrect because Bennett’s actions violated the Code of Ethics and the Standard relating to Professionalism but not the Standard relating to Integrity of Capital Markets.
answerFeedback.f9a3fa78-c5db-45fc-88db-5643d2ba9838: Incorrect because Bennett’s actions violated the Code of Ethics and the Standard relating to Professionalism.

choices.itemBody: A. did not violate any Code or Standard.
B. violated the Professional Misconduct Standard.
C. violated both Misconduct and Integrity of Capital Markets Standards.

entry.title: ITEM_20170420178
entry.itemBody: Tibor Figeczky, CFA, is an equity trader at Global Investment Bank (GB). Figeczky traded the bank’s investment portfolio profitably for the past three years and earned significant bonuses for his efforts. Subsequently, internal auditors of GB formally accused Figeczky of exceeding his trading authority and engaging in unauthorized trades. According to the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct, Figeczky should most likely:

answerFeedback.6498e1fe-a8bc-471c-ba62-56edabe97dcf: Incorrect as the Code and Standards do not prohibit a member from accepting a bonus while an investigation into his professional behavior is conducted. In this case, the member’s actions have been questioned but he has not yet had an opportunity to defend his behavior and may in fact have acted within his authority and earned the compensation fairly.
answerFeedback.68b88762-939f-44c0-b34c-1a0c07df7972: Incorrect as the Code does not require a member to request a suspension of their membership while a complaint is being investigated.
answerFeedback.763717ec-95f8-428e-bf49-a2d3025ddb0b: Correct as members and candidates must self-disclose on the annual Professional Conduct Statement all matters that question their professional conduct, such as involvement in civil litigation or a criminal investigation or being the subject of a written complaint.

choices.itemBody: A. disclose the complaint to CFA Institute.
B. refuse further bonuses until the issue is resolved.
C. request a temporary suspension of his CFA Institute membership.

entry.title: ITEM_20170420217
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements most likely reflects one of the six components of the CFA Code of Ethics? Candidates must:

answerFeedback.7cfaa90d-7d6f-4740-a81f-84f3c266beca: Correct. CFA charterholders and candidates must place the integrity of the investment profession and the interests of clients above their own personal interests.
answerFeedback.985bb8a9-01e6-433f-9e58-5fa51202b2da: Incorrect. Charterholders and candidates must practice and encourage others to participate in a professional and ethical manner that will reflect credit on themselves and the profession. By ignoring unprofessional conduct of others, a member or candidate is not encouraging others to behave in a manner that reflects well on the profession.
answerFeedback.a85fe4f9-e980-47c7-9b3b-02e308bdd0ce: Incorrect. CFA charterholders and candidates must promote the integrity and viability of the global capital markets for the ultimate benefit of society.

choices.itemBody: A. place the integrity of the investment profession above their own interests.
B. promote the viability of the global capital markets for their employer’s benefit.
C. ignore unprofessional conduct displayed by others within the profession.

entry.title: ITEM_20170420057
entry.itemBody: Disclosure of confidential CFA exam information will most likely be detected by the Professional Conduct staff through:

answerFeedback.16cb8f40-6c9c-4a19-9b6a-602c68ddb0b0: Incorrect because members and candidates must self-disclose on the annual Professional Conduct Statement all matters that question their professional conduct, such as involvement in civil litigation or a criminal investigation or being the subject of a written complaint. Disclosure of confidential exam information will not be found on the annual statement.
answerFeedback.2f020eec-1e7d-4145-a018-dd9e17b3a486: Incorrect because candidate conduct is monitored by exam proctors who complete reports on candidates suspected to have violated testing rules during the exam and at the exam center.
answerFeedback.9c2eb04f-ed38-4dfc-8abd-c4ebb01b8be6: Correct because Professional Conduct inquiries come from a number of sources including the monitoring of online and social media to detect disclosure of confidential exam information.

choices.itemBody: A. monitoring online and social media.
B. analysis of Proctor Reports.
C. annual Professional Conduct Statements.
